ai-ud5.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud5.7:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Revata the Doubter was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight, reviewing his own purification through overcoming doubt.
ai-ud5.7:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud5.7:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud5.7:4.1_0: “Any doubts about this world or the world beyond,
ai-ud5.7:4.2_0: about one’s own experiences or those of another:
ai-ud5.7:4.3_0: those who meditate give them all up,
